excerpt: FX has cancelled the international thriller 'The Old Man,' starring Jeff Bridges and John Lithgow, after two seasons.
text: The Old Man Cancelled at FX After 2 SeasonsThe Old Man‘s mission is over: FX has cancelled the international thriller starring Jeff Bridges and John Lithgow after two seasons, TVLine has confirmed. (Our sister site Deadline first reported the news.) A source emphasizes that FX is proud of the show and Season 2 was strong qualitatively, but the show struggled to maintain its momentum with a two-year gap between seasons. Based on the Thomas Perry novel, The Old Man starred Bridges as former CIA operative Dan Chase, who gets called back into action when a shadowy organization looks to eliminate him for what he knows. Lithgow co-starred as FBI official Harold Harper, who has a decades-long history with Chase and begins as his adversary but ends up becoming his ally. Alia Shawkat co-starred as well as FBI agent Angela Adams, who is Harper’s protégé… and Chase’s daughter, it turns out. The Old Man debuted on FX in June 2022 with a seven-episode freshman season, with production delayed first by the COVID pandemic and then due to Bridges’ battle with lymphoma. The premiere became the most-watched cable series premiere in more than a year, and Season 1 earned a number of award nominations, including an Emmy nod for Bridges and Golden Globe nods for Bridges and Lithgow. The series was renewed for a second season the same month it premiered, but production on Season 2 was delayed as well, this time for last year’s dual Hollywood writers’ and actors’ strikes. Season 2 didn’t debut until this September, with the eight-episode season wrapping up in October. (Read our season — and now series — finale recap here.) Will you miss riding along on Chase and Harper’s spy adventures? Hit the comments to share your thoughts on the cancellation news.

The Old Man Cancelled at FX After 2 Seasons

The Old Man‘s mission is over: FX has cancelled the international thriller starring Jeff Bridges and John Lithgow after two seasons, TVLine has confirmed. (Our sister site Deadline first reported the news.) A source emphasizes that FX is proud of the show and Season 2 was strong qualitatively, but the show struggled to maintain its momentum with a two-year gap between seasons.

Based on the Thomas Perry novel, The Old Man starred Bridges as former CIA operative Dan Chase, who gets called back into action when a shadowy organization looks to eliminate him for what he knows. Lithgow co-starred as FBI official Harold Harper, who has a decades-long history with Chase and begins as his adversary but ends up becoming his ally. Alia Shawkat co-starred as well as FBI agent Angela Adams, who is Harper’s protégé… and Chase’s daughter, it turns out.

The Old Man debuted on FX in June 2022 with a seven-episode freshman season, with production delayed first by the COVID pandemic and then due to Bridges’ battle with lymphoma. The premiere became the most-watched cable series premiere in more than a year, and Season 1 earned a number of award nominations, including an Emmy nod for Bridges and Golden Globe nods for Bridges and Lithgow.

The series was renewed for a second season the same month it premiered, but production on Season 2 was delayed as well, this time for last year’s dual Hollywood writers’ and actors’ strikes. Season 2 didn’t debut until this September, with the eight-episode season wrapping up in October. (Read our season — and now series — finale recap here.)

Will you miss riding along on Chase and Harper’s spy adventures? Hit the comments to share your thoughts on the cancellation news.
